Title: FG makes U-turn, says Maths compulsory for Arts students
Summary: FG makes U-turn, says Maths compulsory for Arts students . Maths was no longer compulsory for admission to tertiary institutions . The government has now said that the subject remains mandatory for admission .

Title: NASS Project Funds:  SERAP urges Akpabio, Abbas to explain disbursement of ₦18.6b
Summary: SERAP urges Senate President Godswill Akpabio and Speaker of the House of Representatives Tajudeen Abbas to explain disbursement of ₦18.6b . The Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project (SERAP) has called on the Senate President to provide full details regarding the National Assembly Commission Office Complex

Title: High interest rates by banks killing Nigerians — Afe Babalola
Summary: The founder of Afe Babalola University, Ado Ekiti (ABUAD) has lamented the high rate of interest charged by banks . He said it has made it difficult for the ordinary man to request bank loans .

Title: VP Shetima visits Katsina on Monday, Tuesday
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shetima is scheduled to visit Katsina State on Monday and Tuesday . He is expected to declare open the 9th expanded national Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Clinic .

Title: Drug, alcohol abuse have made Regina Daniels violent, destructive – Ned Nwoko
Summary: Senator Ned Nwoko has reacted to the viral video showing Nollywood actress Regina Daniels in tears, saying, “I cannot stand the violence again”

Title: Tension in Surulere as residents protest construction of cemetery
Summary: Tension has gripped Natufe/Animashaun Community in Surulere, Lagos . Residents trooped out in protest against the construction of a cemetery in their neighbourhood .

Title: We must fast, pray to avert looming disaster — Ojikutu
Summary: The first elected female Deputy Governor in Nigeria, Alhaja Sinatu Ojikutu, has declared October 23, 2025 as a day of fasting, prayer, and sobriety . She urged global supplication for survival and sustenance .

Title: Man escapes death as gunmen kill mother, two sisters in Anambra
Summary: Ifeanyi Emmanuel Nwafor narrowly escaped death when gunmen opened fire on his family . His mother and two sisters were killed in Anambra State .

Title: INEC issues Anambra guber poll notice
Summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has issued a notice of the Nov. 8 governorship election in Anambra . The notice is required by the Electoral Act .

Title: #FreeNnamdiKanu: FCT NSCDC warns protesters against vandalism
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory FCT Command of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps NSCDC has cautioned protesters of the #FreeNnamdiKanuNow movement against vandalizing critical national assets and infrastructure in the territory .
